result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Richard Plant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Count 4 in 14CF01.

miscConds.notes:
Pepin County Case Nos. 13CF18 & 14CM07 were dismissed and read-in for restitution purposes.  
Restitution to be paid according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
Pay all court ordered obligations according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

supervisions.notes: Serve 10 months in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 121 days served.  Work release granted for purposes of education and employment.  Authorize up to 2 hours per week for homemaking services to spend time with his children.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Information

Defendant Travis Richard Plant in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Defendant Travis Richard Plant in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of PSI, no factual inaccuracies.  Statement of victim.  Court also notes has letter from defendant's mother, parties received a copy.  Counsel addresses recommendation.  Defendant addresses the court.  On Count 4, sentence to 10 mos. in PCJ w/credit for 121 days; pay costs; provide DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge.  Count 1, w/hold sentence and place on 5 yrs. probation consecutive to Count 4.  Pay restitution of $4143.17; take all prescribed meds; attend counseling & treatment as set by PP; no possession of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns.  Appeal rights given.

Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Travis Richard Plant in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Defendant Travis Richard Plant in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of plea negotiations in 14CF01, 13CF18, 14CM07.  Defendant will plead to counts 1 & 4 in 14CF01, Counts 2 & 3 w/be DRI.  13CF18 will DRI Counts 1, Dismiss Count 2, 14CM07 Count 1 will DRI.  Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties of Counts 1 & 4 in 14CF01, defendant pleads guilty, found guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed.  Court dismisses Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF01; DRI Count 1 in 13CF18, Dismiss Count 2.; DRI 14CM07.  PSI ordered.  Remove JT.  Condition of release cont'd.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Travis Richard Plant in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Defendant Travis Richard Plant in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H. ask it be scheduled.  Referred to Scheduling Clerk.

Defendant Travis Richard Plant in court, in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a preliminary hearing w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Court sets $2500 cash bond.  Defendant to contact the SPD.  Return date tomorrow.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
